This site is tested and optimized for use on resolutions 800x600, 1024x768 and 1152x864. Higher resolutions (1280x1024) also work fine, lower (640x480) have problems. Full-screen mode should help in this case.

am:content.p: Arcomage is a fantasy turn-based card game. This card game simulates an epic battle between two empires including features such as constructing new buildings, training troops and decimating the enemy empire with standard attacks or sneaky tactics such as intrigue or spells. MArcomage (Multiplayer Arcomage) is an online card game (for two human players) inspired by original Arcomage. There are similarities in gameplay, but there are differences in cards, game rules or victory conditions.

am:content.p:
In order to play, a user must construct his or her own deck and challenge other players. The battle begins as soon as the other side accepts. There is a possibility to chat with your opponent in game.
Advantage of this game is its turn based play style. It allows players to play as often as they like. For example you can play few turns a day, but if you want, you can play all the time, provided you find an opponent willing to play all day as well.
Lets have a look at the deck building section (picture on the left). You can see the card pool at the top of the page. Below are filters, that you can use to select cards that interest you. At the bottom is you deck. Cards are easily added to and removed from the deck. The game is displayed in the right picture. You can see your cards at the top, your empire information on the middle-left. Your opponent's cards are at the bottom and his empire information is in the middle-right. Interesting thing is, that you can see your opponent's cards. In the center are located cards played last turn, for both players. In all sections there is a navigation bar at the top-most part of the screen, which allows you to change sections. For more game information please see the Game manual.
